data.title: Home l Oduduwa University Ipetumodu – learning for human development
data.text:
Oduduwa University was licensed by the Federal Government of Nigeria to operate as a private University on 3rd November 2009 (certificate number: 38). The University was named after the progenitor of the Yoruba race (Oduduwa).

The University is located at Ipetumodu, a town in Osun State, six kilometers (6km) away from Ile-Ife. it is on a parcel of land of about one hundred (100) hectares and is already fairly developed with some infrastructure that will adequately serve for the institutions permanent site. there is enough room and opportunity for expansion if more land is required in the nearest future.

The University has many surrounding towns serving as feeders and support in all is day-to-day activities i.e economically, socially, politically, technologically, etc.

The surrounding towns include: Ipetumodu, Ashipa, Akinlalu, Moror, Edunabon, Yakoyo, Gbongan and Ile-Ife.

The University has a Student Welfare Board which is constituted by the best students drawn from each of the existing Departments. The Board is an Umbrella Union for all the University students.

The students express their opinions through their representatives in the Board. This promotes a cordial relationship between the Management and the students. No traditional students union.

The University Library is headed by the University Librarian who is responsible to the Vice Chancellor for the administration of the University Library and coordination of all Library services in the University.

The objectives of Oduduwa University Library are, among others: to collect the most current materials (print and electronic) in support of learning, teaching and research activities of the university; to disseminate relevant information to clientele; to support the University effort to develop its human and non-human resources; to cooperate with other university libraries in resources sharing through photocopying, inter-library lending and courier services.

The Oduduwa University Alumni Association is excited to announce the arrival of OUI Alumni Connect. This is a new community building platform for OUI’s alumni. It is the only place online where you can find, and connect with, all 5,000 OUI’s alumni. All alumni are automatically enrolled!

Oduduwa University was established by His Royal Eminence Dr. Ramon Adegoke Atobatele Adedoyin Maye Of Yoruba Land for the public benefit and it is recognized globally. Throughout our great history, Kingster has offered access to a wide range of academic opportunities. As a world leader in higher education, the University has pioneered change in all sector.
